variants.name: convert
variants.description: Includes select conversion routines for common types

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependencies.name: py-scikit-build
dependencies.description:
scikit-build is an improved build system generator for CPython
C/C++/Fortran/Cython extensions. It provides better support for
additional compilers, build systems, cross compilation, and locating
dependencies and their associated build requirements. The scikit-build
package is fundamentally just glue between the setuptools Python module
and CMake.

dependencies.name: py-cmake
dependencies.description:
CMake is an open-source, cross-platform family of tools designed to
build, test and package software

dependencies.name: py-make
dependencies.description: Create project layout from jinja2 templates

dependencies.name: py-pybind11
dependencies.description:
pybind11 -- Seamless operability between C++11 and Python. pybind11 is a
lightweight header-only library that exposes C++ types in Python and
vice versa, mainly to create Python bindings of existing C++ code. Its
goals and syntax are similar to the excellent Boost.Python library by
David Abrahams: to minimize boilerplate code in traditional extension
modules by inferring type information using compile-time introspection.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-typing
dependencies.description:
This is a backport of the standard library typing module to Python
versions older than 3.6.

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependencies.name: py-dataclasses
dependencies.description: A backport of the dataclasses module for Python 3.6

dependencies.name: py-pydantic
dependencies.description: Data validation and settings management using Python type hinting.

dependencies.name: py-rich
dependencies.description:
Rich is a Python library for rich text and beautiful formatting in the
terminal.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-uproot
dependencies.description:
ROOT I/O in pure Python and NumPy. Uproot is a reader and a writer of
the ROOT file format using only Python and Numpy. Unlike the standard
C++ ROOT implementation, Uproot is only an I/O library, primarily
intended to stream data into machine learning libraries in Python.
Unlike PyROOT and root_numpy, Uproot does not depend on C++ ROOT.
Instead, it uses Numpy to cast blocks of data from the ROOT file as
Numpy arrays.
